intro: Vyenomus pendula, commonly known as the hanging beauty, is a flowering plant characterized by its delicate, cascading inflorescences. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, pale yellow to cream-colored flowers. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Vyenomus pendula is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
